newsitem.title: DEMOCRATIC REPUBLIC OF CONGO: Great Lakes ministers to meet in Kabila's Congo.
newsitem.headline: Great Lakes ministers to meet in Kabila's Congo.

text.p: Foreign ministers of Rwanda, Burundi and the new Congo will meet on Tuesday in Kinshasa where they hope to revive a regional economic forum laid dormant by years of strife, officials said on Monday.

Salvator Matata, secretary general of the Economic Community of the Great Lakes, told Reuters the three would meet in the capital of the renamed Democratic Republic of Congo with economic experts working to restart the community.
"We have to revive the activities of our regional organisation. Everything was held in abeyance because of the crises we had in the region," he said.

Relations between the then-Zaire and neighbouring Rwanda soured in 1994 when minority Tutsis, driving out a majority Hutu regime that had incited the genocide of hundreds of thousands of Tutsis, took power.

Now that Laurent Kabila's Tutsi-backed alliance is in power after ousting veteran dictator Mobutu Sese Seko last month, the way is open for better relations between the vast Congo and its two tiny but populous eastern neighbours.
A Tutsi-dominated government also runs Burundi.
